idea-plugin.name: Object mother creator
idea-plugin.description:
Creates a java object mothers for selected java class.

https://martinfowler.com/bliki/ObjectMother.html

To use it you must select the java class from which you want to create a ObjectMother, right click and select
"Create object mother for current class"

Then select the test source directory in which you want it to be created and it will replicate the package of the original class and will let the ObjectMother.java file into it.

Also, if selected class receives, in its constructor, another class of your project the objectMother of that class will be generated and used in first one

IMPORTANT: In this version the generated code uses, to generate random Strings, and only because is really funny, Javafaker library in github

You can add it to your project using maven or gradle;

dependencies {
testImplementation "com.github.javafaker:javafaker:1.0.2"
}

Anyway, if you don't want to use javafaker library, this plugin will do the TEDIOUS work of creating the packages, the ObjectMother.java files, and a 'randomClassName' static methods with required parameters and you only would have to change those parameters.
